content: tolosa is a lightweight sweater with graphic twisted cables that run along the sides and cover the hem as well as a textured hem and cuff detail worked seamlessly and top-down it s a quick warm weather knit with short raglan sleeves simple short row to shape the neck and multiple style options you can make it cropped and fitted at the waist for a retro look the sides and hem patterns go in to hug the figure and emphasize the waist with a slight blouse effect or you can opt for a regular length relaxed pullover by choosing a size with more ease instructions are provided to help you adjust the length of the body **sizes ** 1 2 / 3 / 4 / 5 / 6 see last pictures for schematic and complete measurements finished bust circumference 88 95 / 109 / 117 / 131 / 145 5 cm 34 ½ 37 ½ / 43 / 46 / 51 ½ / 57 inches the body length is adjustable from cropped to a regular length choose a size with 5-10 cm 2- 4 inches ease for a waist fitted retro look go up to 15-20 cm 6-8 inches ease for a relaxed fit shown cropped in size 2 on an 88 cm / 34 ½ inches bust **yarn** 750 800 / 950 / 1050 / 1100 / 1200 meters 820 875 / 1040 / 1150 / 1205 / 1315 yards of fingering weight yarn sample used maison corlène belle époque yarn 80% superwash merino - 20% silk 100g - 365 m / 400 yds in sybil semi-solids tonal and lightly speckled colours with a good stitch definition will work best for a waist fitted result use a yarn with some wool content for elasticity summery wool / cotton or linen blends would make great substitutes should you wish to use a yarn with drape but little stretch i recommend that you pick a size with at least 15 cm ease for the looser comfier look **needles ** *main fabric* 4 mm us 6 circular needles with appropriate length to knit in the round and magic loop or dpns *hem and ribbing * 3 5 mm us 4 circular needles with appropriate length to knit in the round and magic loop or dpns or sizes required to get gauge **gauge ** 22 stitches x 27 rounds per 10 cm / 4 inches with larger needles in stockinette stitch after blocking 24 stitches x 43 rounds per 10 cm / 4 inches with smaller needles in hem pattern after blocking i recommend that you swatch with a variety of needle sizes to get as close as possible with 22 st per 10 cm this a very drapy loose fabric in fingering weight you might find that you prefer the look of this gauge with a heavier yarn so don t hesitate to try a sport or a dk this is safer than knitting a different size at a tighter gauge **notions
